docs.title: Your Family Meal Planning Assistant
docs.text: Grocery Gooose helps families plan, budget, and shop for meals - not just ingredients. We make it easy to feed your family well while staying within your budget and focusing on what matters most to you.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Meal Planning 🍽️

    • Browse complete meal recipes
    • Filter by dietary needs and preferences
    • Adjust portions for your family size
    • Weekly meal planning calendar

  • Smart Budgeting 💰

    • Set and track grocery budgets
    • Price comparison across stores
    • Budget-friendly meal suggestions
    • Cost per meal calculations

  • Shopping Made Simple 🛒

    • Automatic shopping lists from meal plans
    • Organize by store or section
    • Track pantry inventory
    • Share lists with family members

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Visit our Quick Start Guide to begin planning meals for your family.

docs.title: Support
docs.text: Need help? Check out our documentation or contact support.

docs.title: Contact Us
docs.text: Have questions about Grocery Goose? We'd love to hear from you!

docs.title: Get in Touch
docs.text: • 📧 Email: support@usegrocerygoose.com

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
We love your input! We want to make contributing to Grocery Gooose as easy and transparent as possible, whether it's:

  • Reporting a bug
  • Discussing the current state of the code
  • Submitting a fix
  • Proposing new features
  • Becoming a maintainer

docs.title: Development Process
docs.text:
1. Fork the repo and create your branch from main
  2. If you've added code that should be tested, add tests
  3. If you've changed APIs, update the documentation
  4. Ensure the test suite passes
  5. Make sure your code lints
  6. Issue that pull request!

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Update the README.md with details of changes if needed
  2. Update the docs with any new features or changes
  3. The PR will be merged once you have the sign-off of two maintainers

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Use Black for Python code formatting
  • Follow PEP 8 guidelines
  • Write meaningful commit messages
  • Document new code using docstrings

docs.title: License
docs.text: By contributing, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Grocery Gooose uses OAuth 2.0 for API authentication. This guide explains how to authenticate your requests to our API.

docs.title: 1. Register Your Application
docs.text: Visit the Developer Portal to: - Create a developer account - Register your application - Get your API credentials

docs.title: 2. Authentication Methods
docs.text: We support multiple authentication methods:

docs.title: OAuth 2.0
docs.text:
POST /oauth/token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=client_credentials
&client_id=YOUR_CLIENT_ID
&client_secret=YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET

docs.title: API Keys
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/products
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: Security Best Practices
docs.text:
• Never share your API keys
  • Rotate keys regularly
  • Use environment variables
  • Implement rate limiting
  • Monitor API usage

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text: Error Code Description 401 Invalid credentials 403 Insufficient permissions 429 Rate limit exceeded

docs.title: List Products
docs.text: GET /api/v1/products

docs.title: Get Product
docs.text: GET /api/v1/products/{id}

docs.title: Search Products
docs.text: GET /api/v1/products/search?q={query}

docs.title: List All Lists
docs.text: GET /api/v1/lists

docs.title: Create List
docs.text: POST /api/v1/lists

docs.title: Update List
docs.text: PUT /api/v1/lists/{id}

docs.title: Get Price History
docs.text: GET /api/v1/products/{id}/prices

docs.title: Set Price Alert
docs.text: POST /api/v1/price-alerts

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
All API responses follow this format:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    // Response data here
  },
  "meta": {
    "page": 1,
    "per_page": 20,
    "total": 100
  }
}

docs.title: Smart Search
docs.text: Grocery Gooose's search engine is designed to help you find exactly what you need:

docs.title: Basic Search
docs.text:
• Real-time suggestions as you type
  • Spell-check and autocorrect
  • Natural language processing

docs.title: Advanced Filters
docs.text:
• Price range
  • Brand preferences
  • Dietary restrictions
  • Store availability

docs.title: Search Operators
docs.text:
Use these special operators to refine your search:

Operator Example Description brand: brand:organic Search specific brands store: store:walmart Filter by store price< price<10 Items under $10 organic: organic:true Only organic items

docs.title: Smart Suggestions
docs.text: Our AI-powered suggestion engine: - Learns from your shopping habits - Suggests frequently bought items - Recommends complementary products - Alerts you about sales on favorite items

docs.title: Search History
docs.text:
• View and manage recent searches
  • Save frequent searches
  • Set up search alerts

docs.title: Smart Lists
docs.text:
• Multiple shopping lists
  • Automatic categorization
  • Price optimization
  • Quantity management

docs.title: Sharing & Collaboration
docs.text:
• Share lists with family
  • Real-time updates
  • Permission controls
  • Comments and notes

docs.title: Price Tracking
docs.text:
• Historical price data
  • Price alerts
  • Best time to buy suggestions
  • Store comparison

docs.title: Basic Operations
docs.text:
1. Add items
  2. Adjust quantities
  3. Remove items
  4. Save for later

docs.title: List Management
docs.text:
• Create new lists
  • Rename lists
  • Archive completed lists
  • Set recurring items

docs.title: Automatic Suggestions
docs.text:
• Frequently bought together
  • Don't forget items
  • Sale alerts
  • Seasonal recommendations

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before using Grocery Gooose, you'll need:

  • A smartphone (iOS or Android)
  • Walmart or Instacart account
  • Internet connection

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Download the App
  2. iOS: [App Store Link]

  3. Android: [Play Store Link]

  4. Connect Your Account 

    # Choose your preferred shopping service:
- Walmart for Pickup/Delivery
- Instacart for multi-store delivery

  5. Set Your Preferences

  6. Family size & dietary needs
  7. Weekly budget
  8. Preferred pickup/delivery times
  9. Store preferences

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text: Setting Description Example Budget Weekly grocery budget $200 Family Size Number of people to feed 4 Delivery Preferred delivery window "Weekday evenings" Store Preferred grocery store "Walmart"

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Start meal planning
  • Browse our recipe collection
  • Learn about budget features

Pro Tip

Connect both Walmart and Instacart accounts to compare prices and availability across stores.

docs.title: Getting Started in 5 Minutes
docs.text:
Follow these simple steps to start planning meals for your family:

  1. Create Your Family Profile
  2. Set your family size
  3. Add dietary preferences/restrictions

  4. Set your weekly grocery budget

  5. Plan Your Meals

  6. Browse meal suggestions based on your preferences
  7. Add meals to your weekly calendar
  8. Adjust portions for your family size

  9. See total cost per meal and week

  10. Shop Smart

  11. Review your auto-generated shopping list
  12. Compare prices across stores
  13. Track your budget as you shop
  14. Check off items as you go

docs.title: Meal Planning
docs.text:
• Browse meals by category
  • Filter by:
  • Budget per meal
  • Cooking time
  • Dietary needs
  • Family favorites

docs.title: Budget Management
docs.text:
• Set weekly/monthly budgets
  • Track spending
  • Find budget-friendly alternatives
  • See cost breakdowns per meal

docs.text:
